FDA Indication: Adjunctive treatment of seizures associated with Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome inpatients 2 years of age or older

CDSCO Indication: Preoperative antimuscarinic to reduce secretions and arrhythmias
FDA Indication: To reduce chronic drooling in patients aged 3 - 16 with neurologic conditions associated with problem drooling (e.g. cerebral palsy)

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of acute promyelocytic leukemia (remission and consolidation)
FDA Indication: In combination with tretinoin for treatment of adults with newly-diagnosed low-risk acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL) whose APL is characterized by the presence of the t(15;17) translocation or PML/RAR-alpha gene expression.

CDSCO Indication: Reduction of chemotherapy-induced neutropenia
FDA Indication: Reduce the duration of neutropenia and neutropenia sequelae in patients with non-myeloid malignancies undergoing ablative chemotherapy followed by BMT.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma in combination therapies
FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with multiple myeloma who have received at least two prior therapies including bortezomib and an immunomodulatory agent and have demonstrated disease progression on or within 60 days of completion of the last therapy.

CDSCO Indication: Used with G-CSF to mobilize hematopoietic stem cells in non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma and multiple myeloma
FDA Indication: To enhance mobilization of hematopoietic stem cells to the peripheral blood for collection and subsequent autologous transplantation in patients with lymphoma and multiple myeloma

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of metastatic colorectal cancer after prior therapies
FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with locally advanced, unresectable or metastatic gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) who have been previously treated with imatinib mesylate and sunitinib malate.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (WHO Group I) to improve exercise ability
FDA Indication: treatment of pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH) (WHO Group I) in pediatric patients 1 to 17 years old to improve exercise ability and, in pediatric patients too young to perform standardized exercise testing, pulmonary hemodynamics thought to underly improvements in exercise

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of movement disorders including Huntington’s chorea, hemiballismus, senile chorea
FDA Indication: Treatment of chorea associated with Huntington's disease

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of angina pectoris, hypertension, and cardiac arrhythmias
FDA Indication: For use as a substitute for oral sotalol in patients who are unable to take sotalol orally [oral sotalol is indicated for maintenance of normal sinus rhythm in patients with history of highly symptomatic atrial fibrillation /flutter, and for treatment of documented life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias]

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of angina pectoris, hypertension, and cardiac arrhythmias
FDA Indication: Treatment of life-threatening ventricular tachyarrhythmias

CDSCO Indication: Treatment and prophylaxis of respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants
FDA Indication: Treatment and prevention of respiratory failure due to pulmonary surfactant deficiency in preterm infants.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of malignant hypertension
FDA Indication: treatment of hyperphagia in adults and pediatric patients 4 years of age and older with Prader-Willi syndrome (PWS)

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of anorexia, cachexia, and weight loss in cancer or AIDS patients
FDA Indication: Treatment of anorexia, cachexia, or an unexplained significant weight loss in patients with a diagnosis of acquired immune deficiency syndrome.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of bleeding esophageal varices
FDA Indication: To improve kidney function in adults with hepatorenal syndrome with rapid reduction in kidney function

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of various cancers including ovarian, breast, testicular, pancreas, and lymphoma
FDA Indication: In combination with certain other approved antineoplastic agents, for third line chemotherapy in the treatment of germ cell testicular cancer.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment and control of parasites in cattle
FDA Indication: treatment of onchocerciasis due to Onchocerca volvulus in adult and pediatric patients aged 4 years and older and weighing at least 13 kg

CDSCO Indication: Maintenance therapy for Crohn's disease and fistulizing Crohn’s
FDA Indication: For reducing signs and symptoms and inducing and maintaining clinical remission in pediatric patients with moderately to severely active Crohn's disease who have had an inadequate response to conventional therapy

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of prostate, ovarian, breast cancer, precocious puberty, uterine fibroids, PCOS, and IVF pre-treatment
FDA Indication: Treatment of pediatric patients 2 years of age and older with central precocious puberty

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of AIDS
FDA Indication: Combination therapy with zidovudine is indicated for the treatment of adult patients with advanced HIV infection (CD4 count < 300) who have demonstrated malignant clinical or immunologic deterioration.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of colorectal cancer
FDA Indication: in combination with oxaliplatin, fluorouracil and leucovorin for the first-line treatment of adult patients with metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma

CDSCO Indication: Monotherapy or in combination for unresectable/metastatic BRAF V600E-positive melanoma
FDA Indication: in combination with trametinib, for the treatment of pediatric patients 1 year of age and older with low-grade glioma (LGG) with a BRAF V600E mutation who require systemic therapy

CDSCO Indication: Carbonic anhydrase inhibitor
FDA Indication: Treatment of primary hyperkalemic periodic paralysis, primary hypokalemic period paralysis, and related variants

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of inflammation and pain associated with ocular surgery
FDA Indication: Treatment of endogenous anterior uveitis

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of Cushing’s disease in non-surgical candidates
FDA Indication: Treatment of adult patients with Cushing's disease for whom pituitary surgery is not an option or has not been curative

CDSCO Indication: Same as approved
FDA Indication: EMFLAZA is indicated for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) in patients 2 years of age and older.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of enterocolitis, urogenital, and other susceptible infections
FDA Indication: Treatment of diarrhea caused by Cryptosporidium parvum and Giardia lamblia

CDSCO Indication: Bulk anesthetic agent
FDA Indication: NAYZILAM is indicated for the acute treatment of intermittent, stereotypic episodes of frequent seizure activity (i.e., seizure clusters, acute repetitive seizures) that are distinct from a patients usual seizure pattern in patients with epilepsy 12 years of age and older.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Riluzole extends survival and/or time to tracheostomy.

CDSCO Indication: Prophylaxis of acute organ rejection in transplantation with cyclosporin and corticosteroids
FDA Indication: Prophylaxis of acute organ rejection in patients receiving renal transplantation when used as part of an immunosuppressive regimen that includes cyclosporine and corticosteroids.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of severe and chloroquine-resistant malaria including cerebral malaria
FDA Indication: Prophylaxis of Plasmodium falciparum malaria which is resistant to other available drugs

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E mutation, as monotherapy or with Dabrafenib
FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with unresectable or metastatic melanoma with BRAF V600E or V600K mutations as detected by an FDA approved test.

CDSCO Indication: Peritoneal dialysis for renal failure
FDA Indication: For use as a single daily exchange for the long (8-16 hour) dwell during continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis (CAPD) or automated peritoneal dialysis (APD) for the management of chronic renal failure.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of cancers including multiple myeloma, Kaposi’s sarcoma, melanoma, leukemia, and other malignancies (specialist only)
FDA Indication: Treatment of chronic myelogenous leukemia.

Treatment of cancers including multiple myeloma, Kaposi’s sarcoma, melanoma, leukemia, and other malignancies (specialist only)
FDA Indication: Treatment of selected patients with AIDS-related Kaposi's sarcoma.

FDA Indication: To reduce chronic drooling in patients aged 3 - 16 with neurologic conditions associated with problem drooling (e.g. cerebral palsy)

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of B-cell chronic lymphocytic leukaemia in patients unresponsive to standard alkylating agent regimens
Treatment of ALK-positive metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) after progression on or intolerance to Crizotinib
FDA Indication: adjuvant treatment in adult patients following tumor resection of anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) (tumors greater than or equal to 4 cm or node positive), as detected by an FDA-approved test

CDSCO Indication: In combination with bortezomib and dexamethasone for treatment of multiple myeloma after at least one prior therapy
FDA Indication: FARYDAK (panobinostat) in combination with bortezomib (BTZ) and dexamethasone (DEX) for the treatment of patients with multiple myeloma who have received at least 2 prior regimens, including bortezomib and an immunomodulatory agent

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of relapsed or chemo-resistant indolent B-cell NHL (specialist use)
FDA Indication: RITUXAN, in combination with glucocorticoids, is indicated for the treatment of adult and pediatric patients 2 years of age and older with Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (GPA) (Wegener?s Granulomatosis) and Microscopic Polyangiitis (MPA)

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of Gaucher disease type 1 in appropriate CYP2D6 phenotypes
FDA Indication: Long-term treatment of adult patients with Gaucher disease type 1 who are CYP2D6 extensive metabolizers (EMs), intermediate metabolizers (IMs), or poor metabolizers (PMs) as detected by an FDA-cleared test.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of endometriosis and central precocious puberty
FDA Indication: Treatment of central precocious puberty (gonadotropin-dependent precocious puberty) in children of both sexes.

CDSCO Indication: Treatment of HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer
FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with HER2 overexpressing metastatic gastric or gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma, who have not received prior treatment for metastatic disease

CDSCO Indication: By neurologist/psychiatrist – to improve wakefulness in narcolepsy
FDA Indication: Improve wakefulness in patients with excessive daytime sleepiness associated with narcolepsy.

FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma

FDA Indication: Prophylaxis of acute organ rejection in patients receiving renal transplants, to be used as a part of an immunosuppressive regimen that includes cyclosporine and corticosteroids.

FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) whose tumors are anaplastic lymphoma kinase (ALK)-positive as detected by an FDA-approved test

FDA Indication: Treatment of anorexia, cachexia, or an unexplained significant weight loss in patients with a diagnosis of acquired immune deficiency syndrome.

FDA Indication: Treatment of patients with CD33 positive acute myeloid leukemia in first relapse who are 60 years of age or older and who are not considered candidates for cytotoxic chemotherapy
